common_errors.cause: systemd user instance not running (inside container or chroot)
common_errors.solution: Run in proper systemd environment. In containers, use --system flag or mock bus.
Use sudo for system-level analysis: sudo systemd-analyze blame
Check unit name: systemctl list-units. Include .service suffix.

common_errors.error_pattern: Startup finished in.*but not all units loaded
common_errors.solution: Check failed units: systemctl --failed. View logs: journalctl -xe

common_errors.error_pattern: Failed to parse kernel command line

common_errors.cause: Feature not available on this systemd version
common_errors.solution: Check systemd version: systemd --version. Feature may require newer version.

common_errors.cause: graphviz not installed (needed for plot output)
common_errors.solution: Install graphviz: apt install graphviz / yum install graphviz
Ensure dbus-daemon running. May not work in minimal containers.
Check unit files. Use systemd-analyze verify to find cycles.
Check valid commands: systemd-analyze --help (blame, plot, critical-chain, etc.)
